    • Constructor Detail

      • Builder

        public Builder(String recipient,
               String content)
        Set the recipient and message content.
        Parameters:
        recipient - The MSISDN of the recipient. The format should follow the ITU-T E.164 standard with a + prefix, e.g. +4792000001.
        content - The message payload to send, typically the message text. See chapter 3.4 in the ITC SMS Gateway API specification for more details

    • Method Detail

      • withPrice

        public Sms.Builder withPrice(int price)
        Set the price of the message.
        Parameters:
        price - The cost for the recipient to receive the message. In lowest monetary unit. See chapter 3.1 in the ITC SMS Gateway API specification for details. Example: 200 (2,- NOK)
        Returns:
        the updated builder

      • withClientReference

        public Sms.Builder withClientReference(String clientReference)
        Arbitrary client reference ID that will be returned in the message response.
        Parameters:
        clientReference - the client message ID
        Returns:
        the updated builder

      • withPriority

        public Sms.Builder withPriority(int priority)
        Set the priority of the message.
        Parameters:
        priority - Uses service value unless specified. Used to prioritize between messages sent from the same service. 1: low (slower) 2: medium 3: high (faster)
        Returns:
        the updated builder

      • withValidity

        public Sms.Builder withValidity(int validity)
        Set a validity for the message.
        Parameters:
        validity - Uses service value unless specified. Specifies the TTL (time to live) for the message, i.e. how long before the message times out in cases where it cannot be delivered to a handset. See chapter 3.3 in the ITC SMS Gateway API specification for valid values. Example: 173
        Returns:
        the updated builder

      • withDifferentiator

        public Sms.Builder withDifferentiator(String differentiator)
        Sets the name of the message group.
        Parameters:
        differentiator - Arbitrary string set by the client to enable grouping messages in certain statistic reports. Example: pincode_messages
        Returns:
        the updated builder

      • withAge

        public Sms.Builder withAge(int age)
        Sets the minimum age of the recipient.
        Parameters:
        age - Only relevant for CPA/GAS messages. Defines an age limit for message content. The mobile network operators enforces this. IMPORTANT: If the service is a subscription service all CPA/GAS messages must have age set to 18.
        Returns:
        the updated builder

      • withNewSession

        public Sms.Builder withNewSession(boolean newSession)
        Start a new session.
        Parameters:
        newSession - Used to start a new session. See chapter 3.5 in the ITC SMS Gateway API specification for details.
        Returns:
        the updated builder

      • withSessionId

        public Sms.Builder withSessionId(String sessionId)
        Use an existing session.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - Used to continue an existing session. See chapter 3.5 in the ITC SMS Gateway API for details.
        Returns:
        the updated builder

      • withInvoiceNode

        public Sms.Builder withInvoiceNode(String invoiceNode)
        Sets a custom group name for the invoice.
        Parameters:
        invoiceNode - Arbitrary string set by the client to enable grouping messages on the service invoice.
        Returns:
        the updated builder

      • withSafeRemoveNonGsmCharacters

        public Sms.Builder withSafeRemoveNonGsmCharacters(boolean safeRemoveNonGsmCharacters)
        Decides if non-GSM characters should be removed from the content text.
        Parameters:
        safeRemoveNonGsmCharacters - Default value is false. If set to true the SMSGW will remove or safely substitute invalid characters in the message content instead of rejecting the message. See chapter 3.4 in the ITC SMS Gateway API for details.
        Returns:
        the updated builder

      • withParameters

        public Sms.Builder withParameters(List<com.intele.chimera.gw.xsd.smsgateway.request._2013._02.Parameter> parameters)

        Used add special parameters to the message. See 3.7.3.4 in the ITC SMS Gateway API for valid keys and values.

        Parameters:
        key -
        value -
        Returns:
        the updated builder

      • withOriginatorSettings

        public Sms.Builder withOriginatorSettings(com.intele.chimera.gw.xsd.smsgateway.request._2013._02.OriginatorTypeEnum originatorType,
                                          String originator)
        Sets the originator.
        Parameters:
        originatorType - Specifies the type of originator. See chapter 3.2 in the ITC SMS Gateway API for details.
        originator - Depends on the originatorType. Examples: "+4799999999", "Intelecom", "1960"
        Returns:
        the updated builder

      • withGasSettings

        public Sms.Builder withGasSettings(GasSettings gasSettings)

        Specify GAS (Goods and Services) values. See chapter 3.1 in the ITC SMS Gateway API for details.

        Parameters:
        gasSettings -
        Returns:
        the updated builder

      • withSendWindow

        public Sms.Builder withSendWindow(SendWindow sendWindow)

        Specify the send window for the message. See chapter 3.6 in the ITC SMS Gateway API.

        Used if the message should be queued and sent in the future instead of immediately.

        Parameters:
        sendWindow -
        Returns:
        the updated builder

      • build

        public Sms build()
        Returns:
        the newly created Sms
